subject: Relationships
title: The AIDS Crisis and Love Under Siege
description: A quick, practical guide to The AIDS Crisis and Love Under Siege.

hook.text: In the 1980s, loving someone could kill you. AIDS turned intimacy into a life-or-death gamble.

buildup.text: The crisis devastated the gay community. Partners nursed lovers while governments looked away.

discovery.text: Love during AIDS demanded radical courage. Couples faced stigma, illness, and loss with fierce devotion.

twist.text: The crisis ultimately strengthened LGBTQ+ solidarity. Shared grief built the movement that won marriage equality.

climax.text: AIDS showed love's terrifying fragility â€” and its extraordinary resilience in the face of death.

punchline.text: A plague that targeted love ultimately made love's defenders stronger.

quiz.question: How did the AIDS crisis affect the LGBTQ+ movement?
options: Shared grief strengthened solidarity and rights advocacy
